item.title: New Subject List
item.description: Based on course-update in late 2017. Effective from Academic year 2074. Related file course-update-TU-official.pdf View Download (917 Kb) a.viewLink{ color: #8451A1; } a.downloadLink{ color: #139948; } Subject Code Subject COMPULSORY CSC 364 Software Engineering(SE) CSC 365 Compiler Design and Construction(CDC) CSC 366 E-Governance(E-gov) CSC 367 NET Centric Computing(NCC) CSC 368 Technical Writing(TW) ELECTIVE Choose any one (atleast) CSC 369 Applied Logic CSC 370 E-Commerce(Ecom) CSC 371 Automation and Robotics(AuRo) CSC 372 Neural Networks CSC 373 Computer Hardware Design(CHD) CSC 374 Cognitive Science(CogSci) table thead th{ background-color: #8451A1; color:#fff; } table tbody tr:nth-child(1), table tbody tr:nth-child(7){ background-color: #eeefff; }

item.title: Old Subject List
item.description: Old subject list for pre-2017 students. Unless otherwise stated, students of Academic year 2074 and later shall not follow this list. Subject Code Subject COMPULSORY CSC 351 Software Engineering(SE) CSC 352 Compiler Design and Construction(CDC) CSC 353 Web Technologies(WebTech) CSC 354 Real Time System(RTS) ELECTIVE Choose any one (atleast) CSC 355 Knowledge Management(KM) CSC 356 Fundamentals of E-Commerce(Ecom) CSC 357 Society and Ethics in Information Technology(SEIT) CSC 358 Automation and Robotics(AuRo) CSC 359 Digital System Design(DSD) CSC 360 Net Centric Computing(NCC) CSC 361 Web Centric Computing(WCC) CSC 362 Embedded System Programming(ESP) CSC 363 Image Processing table thead th{ background-color: #8451A1; color:#fff; } table tbody tr:nth-child(1), table tbody tr:nth-child(6){ background-color: #eeefff; }

item.title: New Syllabus and Microsyllabus

Files a.viewLink{ color: #8451A1; } a.downloadLink{ color: #139948; } PDF a.viewLink{ color: #8451A1; } a.downloadLink{ color: #139948; } Files are bundled and zipped only when collections are complete This is YOUR website. item.title: All Other Subjects
item.description: We currently lack content on the following subjects. Help us out by contributing, if you’ve got them: Subject Code Subject CSC 355 Knowledge Management(KM) CSC 357 Society and Ethics in Information Technology(SEIT) CSC 358 Automation and Robotics(AuRo) CSC 359 Digital System Design(DSD) CSC 361 Web Centric Computing(WCC) CSC 362 Embedded System Programming(ESP) + All notes for the recently revised subject-list(See List of Subjects>New Subject List for more info)

item.title: Credits
item.description: Contributors for 6th Sem Thanks to them for making CSIT community a better place ! .ghContributors { display:flex; flex-flow: wrap; align-content: flex-start } .ghContributors div { width: 50% ; display: inline-flex; } .ghContributors div label { padding-left: 4px ; } .ghContributors div span{ padding-left: 4px ; } .ghContributors img.imgStyle{ vertical-align:middle; margin-bottom:.25em; } .ghContributors div { margin-bottom: 5px; } .ghContributors div span { font-size: x-small; } .

item.title: How to Contribute
item.description: This is the barebones graph TD; A(Decide to Contribute) --|fork the repository| B[Make Desired Changes] B -- C{Is Change Good?} C --|NO| D[Make it good] D -- C C --|YES| E[Good! You're ready to share it with everybody] E --|commit and push to your forked repository| F(Make a pull request) I am a bit confused The pages on this site are generated from the csitauthority/6thSem repository on GitHub.

item.title: Two Strokes
item.description: Minimal. Fast. Robust. The migration from Blogger CMS to Hugo demanded something radical. Following the design language, this is the answer. Two Strokes is completely vector generated with just two strokes and some mathematics! Why does it matter? Well, for starters, its scalable from that to this and, thats not the end of it. It renders fast; no compromises for Hugo. Now, only TU keeps you waiting, not our DOM.
